name: UUserWidget
doc: A widget that enables UI extensibility through WidgetBlueprint.

OnVisibilityChanged: Called when the visibility has changed
PreviewBackground:
A preview background that you can use when designing the UI to get a sense of scale on the screen.  Use
a texture with a screenshot of your game in it, for example if you were designing a HUD.
TickFrequency:
This widget is allowed to tick. If this is unchecked tick will never be called, animations will not play correctly, and latent actions will not execute.
Uncheck this for performance reasons only
ColorAndOpacity: The color and opacity of this widget.  Tints all child widgets.
ForegroundColor:
The foreground color of the widget, this is inherited by sub widgets.  Any color property
that is marked as inherit will use this color.
Padding: The padding area around the content.
bIsFocusable: Setting this flag to true, allows this widget to accept focus when clicked, or when navigated to.

methods.name: AddExtension
methods.doc: Add the extension of the requested type.

methods.name: AddToPlayerScreen
AddToViewport
BindToAnimationEvent
BindToAnimationFinished
BindToAnimationStarted
CancelLatentActions
methods.doc: Cancels any pending Delays or timer callbacks for this widget.

methods.name: Construct
methods.doc:
Called after the underlying slate widget is constructed.  Depending on how the slate object is used
this event may be called multiple times due to adding and removing from the hierarchy.
If you need a true called-once-when-created event, use OnInitialized.

methods.name: Destruct
methods.doc:
Called when a widget is no longer referenced causing the slate resource to destroyed.  Just like
Construct this event can be called multiple times.

methods.name: FlushAnimations
methods.doc: Flushes all animations on all widgets to guarantee that any queued updates are processed before this call returns

methods.name: GetAnimationCurrentTime
GetExtension
methods.doc: Find the first extension of the requested type.

methods.name: GetExtensions
methods.doc: Find the extensions of the requested type.

methods.name: GetOwningPlayerCameraManager
methods.doc:
Gets the player camera manager associated with this UI.
@return Gets the owning player camera manager that's owned by the player controller assigned to this widget.

methods.name: GetOwningPlayerPawn
methods.doc:
Gets the player pawn associated with this UI.
@return Gets the owning player pawn that's owned by the player controller assigned to this widget.

methods.name: IsAnimationPlaying
IsAnimationPlayingForward
methods.doc:
returns true if the animation is currently playing forward, false otherwise.

@param InAnimation The playing animation that we want to know about

methods.name: IsAnyAnimationPlaying
methods.doc: @return True if any animation is currently playing

methods.name: IsInteractable
methods.doc: Gets a value indicating if the widget is interactive.

methods.name: IsListeningForInputAction
methods.doc: Checks if the action has a registered callback with the input component.

methods.name: IsPlayingAnimation
methods.doc: Are we currently playing any animations?

methods.name: ListenForInputAction
methods.doc:
Listens for a particular Player Input Action by name.  This requires that those actions are being executed, and
that we're not currently in UI-Only Input Mode.

methods.name: OnAddedToFocusPath
OnAnalogValueChanged
OnAnimationFinished
methods.doc:
Called when an animation has either played all the way through or is stopped

@param Animation The animation that has finished playing

methods.name: OnAnimationStarted
methods.doc:
Called when an animation is started.

@param Animation the animation that started

methods.name: OnDragCancelled
OnDragDetected
OnDragEnter
OnDragLeave
OnDragOver
OnDrop
OnFocusLost
methods.doc:
Called when this widget loses focus.  This event does not bubble.

@param  InFocusEvent  FocusEvent

methods.name: OnFocusReceived
OnInitialized
methods.doc:
Called once only at game time on non-template instances.
While Construct/Destruct pertain to the underlying Slate, this is called only once for the UUserWidget.
If you have one-time things to establish up-front (like binding callbacks to events on BindWidget properties), do so here.

methods.name: OnKeyChar
OnKeyDown
OnKeyUp
OnMotionDetected
OnMouseButtonDoubleClick
OnMouseButtonDown
OnMouseButtonUp
OnMouseCaptureLost
methods.doc: Called when mouse capture is lost if it was owned by this widget.

methods.name: OnMouseEnter
OnMouseLeave
methods.doc:
The system will use this event to notify a widget that the cursor has left it. This event is NOT bubbled.

@param MouseEvent Information about the input event

methods.name: OnMouseMove
OnMouseWheel
OnPreviewKeyDown
OnPreviewMouseButtonDown
OnRemovedFromFocusPath
OnTouchEnded
OnTouchForceChanged
OnTouchGesture
OnTouchMoved
OnTouchStarted
PauseAnimation
PlayAnimation
PlayAnimationForward
PlayAnimationReverse
PlayAnimationTimeRange
PreConstruct
methods.doc:
Called by both the game and the editor.  Allows users to run initial setup for their widgets to better preview
the setup in the designer and since generally that same setup code is required at runtime, it's called there
as well.

**WARNING**
This is intended purely for cosmetic updates using locally owned data, you can not safely access any game related
state, if you call something that doesn't expect to be run at editor time, you may crash the editor.

In the event you save the asset with blueprint code that causes a crash on evaluation.  You can turn off
PreConstruct evaluation in the Widget Designer settings in the Editor Preferences.

QueueStopAllAnimations
methods.doc: Stop All actively running animations.

methods.name: QueueStopAnimation
methods.doc:
Stops an already running animation in this widget

@param The name of the animation to stop

methods.name: RegisterInputComponent
methods.doc:
ListenForInputAction will automatically Register an Input Component with the player input system.
If you however, want to Pause and Resume, listening for a set of actions, the best way is to use
UnregisterInputComponent to pause, and RegisterInputComponent to resume listening.

methods.name: RemoveExtension
methods.doc: Remove the extension.

methods.name: RemoveExtensions
methods.doc: Remove all extensions of the requested type.

methods.name: ReverseAnimation
methods.doc:
If an animation is playing, this function will reverse the playback.

@param InAnimation The playing animation that we want to reverse

methods.name: SetAnimationCurrentTime
SetColorAndOpacity
methods.doc:
Sets the tint of the widget, this affects all child widgets.

@param InColorAndOpacity     The tint to apply to all child widgets.

methods.name: SetForegroundColor
SetNumLoopsToPlay
SetOwningPlayer
methods.doc:
Sets the local player associated with this UI via PlayerController reference.
@param LocalPlayerController The PlayerController of the local player you want to be the conceptual owner of this UI.

methods.name: SetPadding
methods.doc: Sets the padding for the user widget, putting a larger gap between the widget border and it's root widget.

methods.name: SetPlaybackSpeed
SetPositionInViewport
StopAllAnimations
methods.doc:
Stop All actively running animations.

@param The name of the animation to stop

methods.name: StopAnimation
methods.doc:
Stops an already running animation in this widget

@param The name of the animation to stop

methods.name: StopAnimationsAndLatentActions
methods.doc: Cancels any pending Delays or timer callbacks for this widget, and stops all active animations on the widget.

methods.name: StopListeningForAllInputActions
methods.doc: Stops listening to all input actions, and unregisters the input component with the player controller.

methods.name: StopListeningForInputAction
methods.doc: Removes the binding for a particular action's callback.

methods.name: Tick
UnbindFromAnimationFinished
UnbindFromAnimationStarted
UnregisterInputComponent
methods.doc:
StopListeningForAllInputActions will automatically Register an Input Component with the player input system.
If you however, want to Pause and Resume, listening for a set of actions, the best way is to use
UnregisterInputComponent to pause, and RegisterInputComponent to resume listening.
